    • Method Detail

      • setState

        public void setState(S state)
        Runs the behavior defined for the current state if the state provided as argument is a different state. Nothing is done otherwise or if no behavior has been defined the current state or if the one provided was null.

        The behavior is executed before the current state of the machine is updated to the new one.

        Note that the difference is tested with equals.

        Specified by:
        setState in class StateMachine<S>
        Parameters:
        state - The new state that the machine will take.
